column4: what wil this one-liner bash script do: for word in `cat a.txt`; do; grep $word b.txt; if [ $? -eq 0 ]; do echo $word >> c.txt; fi; done;    ?
Every word that is in both a.txt and b.txt will be copied to c.txt
i have a large file. and a smal file. i want to delete words in large file that match with words with words in smal file.
